comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -108,6 +108,7 @@ if(CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "Clang")
         set(THREADS_PREFER_PTHREAD_FLAG ON)
         find_package(Threads REQUIRED)
         set(OQS_USE_PTHREADS_IN_TESTS 1)
+        set(OQS_USE_PTHREADS_IN_LIBOQS 1)
comment.body: Are you 100% sure pthreads is available if `clang` is the compiler?

pull_request.title: Call Keccak_(X4_)Dispatch with pthread_once
pull_request.body:
Fixes #1548.

Call Keccak_(X4_)Dispatch using pthread_once to ensure setting of global function pointers is atomic and done only once.

* [x] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  NO
* [x] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? NO

comment.body: Same question wrt `gcc`. What about rather checking for presence of `pthreads` (e.g., as per https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1620918/cmake-and-libpthread)?

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -108,6 +108,7 @@ if(CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "Clang")
         set(THREADS_PREFER_PTHREAD_FLAG ON)
         find_package(Threads REQUIRED)
         set(OQS_USE_PTHREADS_IN_TESTS 1)
+        set(OQS_USE_PTHREADS_IN_LIBOQS 1)
comment.body: I am using the same logic as test_kem and test_sig for [`#include`ing `<pthread.h>`](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/a80fdf8ee48ea979b5b90ceba026610338608ce0/tests/test_kem.c#L10) and [linking the library](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/a80fdf8ee48ea979b5b90ceba026610338608ce0/tests/CMakeLists.txt#L72), so I am perplexed about why it's not working here. Besides, the `cmake` step should fail if pthreads is not found since the `find_package` is called with `REQUIRED`.
